page.title: 13Moss farming near Formby (1)
page.content: There are many farms to the east of the A565, including{North Moss Farm, which has cattle and sheep, and {Headbolt Farm,}which combines dairy and arable farming. The work of a farmer in the 1980's involves long hours and hard work. For example, in the Spring a cattle farmer may rise at 6am., and by 9am when he eats breakfast, he has already checked and fed his livestock, called the vet and ordered any supplies. The rest of the morning is taken up with attending to any medical problems and feeding orphaned animals. The afternoon may be taken up with cleaning out farm buildings and putting in clean bedding. After dinner, at about 7pm, he does his final check on the animals and buildings.
